qas.question: What church was widespread across Europe at this time?

answers.text: by the feudal lords (kings, dukes and other landowners)

qas.question: Which periods saw a quick growth in Monasticism?
What types of church were the Benedictines known for?
What is one type of Benedictine order that was common in France?
What church was widespread across Asia at this time?

plausible_answers.text: by the feudal lords (kings, dukes and other landowners)

qas.question: Which periods saw a very slow growth in Monasticism?
What types of church were the Benedictines unknown for?
What is one type of Benedictine order that was rare in France?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>The Catholic Church<b5_0/><a0_0/> prevailed across Europe at this time, influencing not only faith but also wealth and power. Bishops were appointed <a1_0><b6_0>by the feudal lords (kings, dukes and other landowners)<b6_0/><a1_0/> and they often ruled as virtual princes over large estates. <a2_0><b7_0>The early Medieval periods<b7_0/><a2_0/> had seen a rapid growth in monasticism, with several different orders being prevalent and spreading their influence widely. Foremost were the Benedictines whose <a3_0><b8_0>great abbey churches<b8_0/><a3_0/> vastly outnumbered any others in France and England. A part of their influence was that towns developed around them and they became centers of culture, learning and commerce. The Cluniac and <a4_0><b9_0>Cistercian Orders<b9_0/><a4_0/> were prevalent in France, the great monastery at Cluny having established a formula for a well planned monastic site which was then to influence all subsequent monastic building for many centuries.
